title.value: FoMo-Bench: a multi-modal, multi-scale and multi-task Forest Monitoring Benchmark for remote sensing foundation models
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: FoMo-Bench: a multi-modal, multi-scale and multi-task Forest Monitoring Benchmark for remote sensing foundation models

extractions.description: The paper introduces FoMo-Bench, a comprehensive benchmark designed for evaluating forest-monitoring foundation models. It includes 15 diverse datasets featuring satellite, aerial, and inventory data, covering multiple geographical regions and various sensory modalities such as multispectral, red-green-blue, synthetic aperture radar (SAR), and LiDAR data. The benchmark encompasses multiple forest-monitoring tasks, including classification, segmentation, and object detection. Additionally, the paper proposes FoMo-Net, a baseline foundation model capable of processing any combination of commonly used spectral bands in remote sensing.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results and baseline evaluations on multiple datasets suggesting an empirical approach.
type.quote: We here present the first unified Forest Monitoring Benchmark (FoMo-Bench). FoMo-Bench consists of 15 diverse datasets encompassing satellite, aerial, and inventory data, ... Finally, we propose FoMo-Net, a baseline foundation model ...

name.justification: The paper leverages computer vision techniques for remote sensing and forest monitoring tasks such as classification, segmentation, and object detection.
name.quote: Inspired by the rise of foundation models for computer vision and remote sensing, ... FoMo-Bench includes multiple types of forest-monitoring tasks, spanning classification, segmentation, and object detection.

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is on applying computer vision and deep learning techniques to remote sensing data for forest monitoring.
name.quote: FoMo-Bench consists of 15 diverse datasets encompassing satellite, aerial, and inventory data, covering a variety of geographical regions, and including multispectral, red-green-blue, synthetic aperture radar (SAR) and LiDAR data ...

name.justification: FoMo-Net is introduced as a baseline foundation model for multi-modal and multi-task remote sensing applications.
name.quote: Finally, we propose FoMo-Net, a baseline foundation model with the capacity to process any combination of commonly used spectral bands in remote sensing.

name.justification: TalloS is described as a novel dataset introduced in the paper, focused on tree species classification with global coverage and multi-modal data.
name.quote: To improve the geographic diversity of FoMo-Bench, we also propose TalloS, a unique, global, multi-modal dataset focused on tree species identification ...

name.justification: The paper mentions using the BigEarthNet-MM dataset for land use/land cover classification in the benchmark.
name.quote: FoMo-Bench includes seven datasets involving satellite imagery, namely BigEarthNet-MM, ...

name.justification: Sen12MS is cited as one of the multi-modal datasets incorporated in the FoMo-Bench benchmark.
name.quote: The BigEarthNet-MM [59] and Sen12MS [57] datasets are two of the most commonly used multi-modal datasets for LULC in remote sensing.

name.justification: The dataset is part of the FoMo-Bench and is used for land use and land cover estimation tasks.
name.quote: FoMo-Bench also includes RapidAI4EO as a third LULC dataset with a unique source of high resolution satellite imagery ...

name.justification: ForestNet is part of the datasets used for identifying drivers of deforestation in the benchmark.
name.quote: The ForestNet dataset [29] aims to identify drivers leading to deforestation and uses Landsat-8 imagery.

name.justification: The dataset provides high-resolution imagery and is part of FoMo-Bench.
name.quote: FiveBillionPixels dataset provides high resolution Gaofen-2 images (4m) for LULC of cities in China with 24 categories including 5 forest monitoring classes.

name.justification: The dataset is utilized for tree species identification using multi-modal data.
name.quote: The TreeSatAI dataset offers multi-modal data (e.g. aerial images, SAR and multispectral) for tree species identification.

name.justification: NeonTree is included for tree crown segmentation tasks and offers high-resolution aerial data.
name.quote: The NeonTree dataset focuses on tree crown detection with RGB imagery, LiDAR and hyperspectral data recorded from airborne systems.

name.justification: The dataset is used for detecting invasive tree species with UAV imagery.
name.quote: The Woody dataset is composed of RGB images recorded from a UAV, at several cm resolution, for detection of several invasive tree species in Chile.

name.justification: ReforesTree combines UAV recordings with inventories for tree detection and estimation of their biomass.
name.quote: The ReforesTree dataset is designed for tree crown detection with 6 classes using high-resolution RGB images recorded from an UAV ...

name.justification: Spekboom dataset is used for mapping tree species using UAV imagery.
name.quote: Similarly, the Spekboom dataset is composed of RGB images recorded from UAVs to map tree species in South Africa.

name.justification: Waititu dataset is employed for tree species mapping using UAV imagery.
name.quote: Similarly, the Waititu dataset is composed of RGB images recorded from UAVs to map tree species in New Zealand.

name.justification: FLAIR #1 dataset provides high-resolution aerial images and elevation maps for wide area spatiotemporal generalization tasks.
name.quote: These datasets test LULC classification according to 19 classes, including coniferous and deciduous forest.

name.justification: FLAIR #2 expands on FLAIR #1 by including high-resolution timeseries data from Sentinel-2.
name.quote: Unlike the previous aerial datasets, FLAIR #1 and FLAIR #2 are large-scale datasets testing spatiotemporal generalization.

name.justification: The dataset offers LiDAR point clouds and semantic annotations for several countries.
name.quote: The FORinstance dataset provides a unique source of data with LiDAR point clouds and semantic annotations collected in 5 countries.
